common

Class AbstractByteReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.AbstractByteReader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RandomAccessByteReader, SequentialByteReader

    public abstract class AbstractByteReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class provides the functionality to perform reader operations intended for obtaining data from a byte array. Data can either be read sequentially or at random, depending on the implementing sub-classes.
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • byteOrder

        private java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractByteReader

        public AbstractByteReader(byte[] buf,
                          int startIndex,
                          java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Constructs an instance to store the specified byte array containing payload data and the byte order to interpret the input bytes correctly. The offset specifies the starting position within the array to read from.
        Parameters:
        buf - an array of bytes acting as the buffer
        startIndex - specifies the starting position within the specified array
        order - the byte order, either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

    • Method Detail

      • validateByteIndex

        private void validateByteIndex(long position,
                               int length)
        Checks whether the specified position is within the byte array’s bounds. If the position is out of range, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        position - the relative index from baseIndex (0 means first readable byte)
        length - the total number of bytes to check (must be <= Integer.MAX_VALUE)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the position is out of bounds

      • getByte

        protected byte getByte(long position)
        Returns a single byte from the array at the specified relative position.
        Parameters:
        position - the index (relative to baseIndex) in the byte array
        Returns:
        the byte at the specified position

      • getBytes

        protected byte[] getBytes(long position,
                          int length)
        Copies and returns a sub-array from the byte array, starting from the specified position.
        Parameters:
        position - the index (relative to baseIndex) in the byte array
        length - the total number of bytes to include in the sub-array (must be <= Integer.MAX_VALUE)
        Returns:
        a new byte array containing the specified subset of the original array

      • getBaseIndex

        public int getBaseIndex()
        Retrieves the offset pointer to the byte array, where read operations can start from.
        Returns:
        the base offset

      • setByteOrder

        public void setByteOrder(java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Sets the byte order for interpreting the input bytes correctly.
        Parameters:
        order - the byte order for interpreting the input bytes

      • getByteOrder

        public java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
        Returns the byte order, indicating how data values will be interpreted correctly.
        Returns:
        either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

      • length

        public long length()
        Returns the length of the readable portion of the byte array (buffer length minus baseIndex).
        Returns:
        the readable array length

      • peek

        public byte peek(long offset)
        Retrieves the data at the specified offset within the byte array without advancing the position.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset (relative to baseIndex)
        Returns:
        the byte of data

      • peek

        public byte[] peek(long offset,
                   int length)
        Retrieves a sub-array of bytes at the specified offset without advancing the position.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset (relative to baseIndex)
        length - the total number of bytes to include in the sub-array
        Returns:
        the sub-array of bytes

      • dumpRawBytes

        public java.lang.String dumpRawBytes()
        Returns a formatted string representation of the raw buffer contents, primarily intended for debugging.
        Returns:
        string containing a hex dump of the buffer
